title: 5 Year Absence: A returning players thoughts.
body:
Just a few thoughts on the state of the game since I last played, which was 5 years ago.

So far I've played a few games of ranked solo play and I'm really enjoying the game so far. All the changes made to the game since I last played have been overall very positive. The visuals are great, the option to prechoose your lane is fantastic. I don't see an option to make premade item sets for individual characters anymore which is unfortunate. As far as toxicity goes, it seems to be less prevalent which makes the game much more enjoyable, although there's still some finger pointing and griping going on but it's nowhere near as bad as it used to be.

I think my only gripes are the lack of premade item builds and the over abundance of too many items. I think riot should streamline the items in the game to be simpler and reduce the total number of items by atleast 30%.

Anywho that's just my thoughts on the game. I was a gold ranked player when I quit, so maybe that helps give my opinions a little more credibility.

Thanks for reading!

EDIT: For those questioning my history I logged in once a few years ago to look at some of the changes but I did not play long term. I quit playing shortly after the game changed to the bronze,silver,gold and reached gold rank. Before that I was 1600ish ELO. I started playing shortly before they removed IP farming in AI games (around the time trundle came out.) Not that it matters. Point is, I've been inactive from a competitive stand point for a long time and I just wanted to share my thoughts. Thanks for all the responses.

EDIT2: Are they reworking the preset item system? And do we have a release date?

At least Bloodthirster has some form of competition for melee (Ravenous Hydra) and AD Casters (Essence Reaver) and can be paired with them if desired, but it isn't the only one competing for attention in its type.

Welcome back. Items take a bit time to get used to. There are go to items, others are situational. Recommended item list usually helps.
Nah, LoL needs more Items actually. We need more niche items useful in certain matchups to prevent certain champions from being impossible to counter.
No thanks. If you want a bazillion items, go play DOTA.

We don't need a bazillion, but I think part of LoL's balance issues it that you sort of hit a dead end when it comes to planning on how to work out your situation in the game.

Too many champs share the same staple items, and there's not many filler items either. This strong lack of variety makes it so Riot just flips what's strong from one week to the next rather than there being a shared space of power.
Glad someone else gets it.

Like, think about it: There's not many items that help deal with a type of situation for different styles of champs. That means that instead of buying items to help deal with a guy or two, you ask Riot to nerf them because they're just blatantly strong.

Plus, the stat-stick nature of every item ensures that every change to an item is going to push someone up too far, either purposefully or accidentally. You'd think that having a 75-80% "expected build" path would make things easier to balance, but it doesn't. Stat-sticks are dangerous for this reason.

They're called "bad matchups". Certain champions will be naturally stronger against other champions.

What I absolutely don't want is League turning into DOTA where you have about 100 different items with their own active abilities that have to be mastered and balanced all on their own. Too many actives reduces the differentiation between champions and makes balancing (something Riot is really, really bad at) that much harder.

Oh yeah? And why does it seem like *every patch* there's a new 55%+ win rate champ that everyone's gotta ban and cry for nerfs on? Why does the LCS have such shit champ diversity? It isn't an issue of bad match-ups anymore. It's an issue of the game environment literally being *unable* to support more than a small percentage of the roster at once. There's simply not enough variety. Too many champs accomplish and build the exact same thing, and when you have 3 variants of the same general tool, most people flock to the best tool.

No one's asking for 150 full build items, but not having enough is definitely showing its side effects.

>And why does it seem like every patch there's a new 55%+ win rate champ that everyone's gotta ban and cry for nerfs on?

Because this community complains about literally everything, justified or not.

>Why does the LCS have such shit champ diversity?

LCS is basically enforced meta slavery. Nobody has the time to try new things.

Welcome back, personally I disagree heavily with your view on items. The game needs more items that have effects rather than just passively sitting there more interactive gameplay is, in my opinion, better and makes the game much more fun. Sure there are a lot of items but having more than enough items is much better than having too few items.

While I agree with the idea that more items improves champion balance, on the flipside, alot of items makes the game difficult to learn for newer players and could turn away potential revenue for Riot and could contribute to player growth stagnation.

I think the premade item system helps alleviate this issue though, and would like to see it added back to the game. This was probably my biggest gripe since returning. Back in the old days there were less items so there wasn't a need for a premade item set system.
